page.title: 02Industry in Boreham Wood
page.content: Some large national and international companies are situated in Elstree Way. Hunting Surveys, Goodyear, Fyffes and Christian Salveson are on the north side. Opposite are GEC, Sellotapes, Stanelco and Bonar Instruments. There is an industrial estate behind Elstree Way. Some of the companies have moved from sites which were closer to the centre of London. They told us that there were easier road communications from Boreham Wood. Elstree Way intersects with the A1(T) north and southbound. These companies provide a wide range of services and products from cold storage at Christian Salveson to Laings, an international building company with interests as far afield as New Zealand. Laings have a mainframe computer base here.
